intro: Loasa ramirezii, commonly known as the Ramirez's loasa, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a distinctive central column. Loasa ramirezii is adapted to rocky soils and is often found in high-altitude environments.
